snippet: Meteorologists say it is likely to paralyze Atlanta again and bring up to eight inches of snow to mountainous regions to the north and as much as an inch of ice to heavily populated parts of Georgia and South Carolina.
abstract: Georgia officials, after being widely mocked for their slow response to a January snow and ice storm, are taking the opposite approach to latest storm that is predicted to clobber the state; meteorologists say storm is likely to paralyze Atlanta again and bring up to eight inches of snow to the mountainous north and as much as an inch of ice to heavily populated parts of Georgia and South Carolina.

byline.contributor: Jim Noles contributed reporting from Birmingham, Ala.

lead_paragraph: Meteorologists say it is likely to paralyze Atlanta again and bring up to eight inches of snow to mountainous regions to the north and as much as an inch of ice to heavily populated parts of Georgia and South Carolina.

headline.main: New Storm Has South Bracing for the Worst
headline.print_headline: New Storm Has South Bracing for the Worst
